instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EFI lock
threads.message:
Sorry title is wrong its a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A ( 2015 15" retina)
Boots to question mark folder then grey padlock when I boot to ALT

From what I've gathered this is an EFI lock and I have looked at other peoples bin's before and after someone unlocked them and seem to be getting different results
Some change the 3 7F to 7C in the $SVS area and some just FF the entire area after the first $SVS until the second.

Are both ways acceptable? I'm still waiting for my soic8 to dip8 adaptors to arrive, so just want to get everything ready.
just to double check this uses the same ssd's as the 2013 & 2014 air and retinas right?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EFI lock
threads.message:
Both can work but I have had issues. If you have issue just upload the dump here.
Since when does a 3330 use a retina SSD? Just a normal 2.5"

Edit:
Oh title wrong....
I believe 2015 SSD has some different temp sensors so using a 2013 SSD in there wil give errors.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EFI lock
threads.message: All went well I replaced the entire section with FF and did a pram reset. Thank you
